item.title: Study Abroad Applications Now Being Accepted for Spring 2025
item.description: The Office of International Programs’ application portal is now open to undergraduate students who wish to apply for spring 2025 study abroad. Deadlines, contact info, and application guidelines are available via the International Programs website.

item.title: RPI Libraries Join PALCI Consortium
item.description: The Rensselaer Libraries are pleased to announce that they have recently joined the Partnership for Academic Library Collaboration and Innovation, or PALCI. With this membership, which replaces the Libraries’ previous ConnectNY services, Rensselaer students, faculty, and researchers will gain access to and benefit from PALCI’s extensive resource-sharing network, which includes academic and research libraries and a vast collection of over 46 million items shared by member institutions.
item.author: Community

item.title: Updated Laboratory Safety Course Available in Percipio
item.description: Environmental Health & Safety (EHS), in collaboration with Human Resources, has updated Rensselaer’s laboratory safety course, which is an important part of Rensselaer’s overall safety program and provides the campus community with resources for conducting laboratory activities in a safe and efficient manner. Students, faculty and staff who work in laboratory and research spaces are required to take Rensselaer’s Laboratory Safety Series, which is now available in Percipio.
item.author: Community

item.title: Be a Part of the Incoming RPI Student Sendoff!
item.description: From 1PM to 3PM on Sunday, August 11 at Pat’s Barn in the Rensselaer Technology Park, come join the RPI Alumni Chapter of Hudson Mohawk to meet and welcome local first-year students from the Class of 2028! It’s a great way to enjoy food and refreshments while making connections, sharing stories, and networking with our newest class. The cost is $10 per person; all local current and incoming RPI students area are invited free of charge courtesy of the Hudson Mohawk Chapter alumni.

item.title: Joint ECSE/COGS Seminar to be Held August 5
item.description: Date: Monday, August 5, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Join ECSE and COGS for a seminar titled “Transforming General-Purpose Robots into Trusted Teammates with HARMONIC,” with Dr. Sanjay Oruganti, Post-doctoral Researcher in the Language-Endowed Intelligent Agents (LEIA) Lab in Rensselaer’s Cognitive Science Department.

item.title: CCPD to Hold URP/Handshake Faculty Training Session
item.description: On Friday, August 16, from 9:30AM to 11:00AM in DCC 209, CCPD will host an interactive opportunity for faculty members to learn how to use Handshake for posting undergraduate research positions. Participants will learn about Handshake, set up an employer profile, and prepare to post their first job. Light snacks will be provided. Space is limited, so interested faculty should register as soon as possible.
